Town Council Newsletter
=======================

[< Back](https://www.lvtexas.us/news)

![](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/cb275a_b8e8ddf0c1b641e193f554df48e0f61d~mv2.jpg/v1/fill/w_980,h_942,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,enc_auto/cb275a_b8e8ddf0c1b641e193f554df48e0f61d~mv2.jpg)

Oct 8, 2025

**The Town Council continues taking Advisory Board applications for the Board of Ethics, Public Library Board and Parks & Recreation. If you are passionate about the future of our community, reach out to City Hall for an application.**

**The Townâ€™s Fall Festival is scheduled for Saturday, October 25, 2025, at Roloff Park. Vendors wishing to participate can reach out to City Hall to sign up and join the community for a fun filled afternoon.**

**Our Public Works Department has installed two new stop signs at the corner of Fernandez Street and Hallam Street to help ensure continued safety for everyone in our community.**

**As we recognize Fire Prevention Week, the Town of Laguna Vista encourages everyone to take a few moments to review your home fire safety plan, test smoke alarms, identify escape routes, and talk to your family about what to do in an emergency.**

**Your safety is our priority, and Fire Chief Waters is available to answer any questions or concerns related to fire safety or prevention in our community.**

**ðŸ§¯ If youâ€™d like more information, or have concerns about fire prevention, please donâ€™t hesitate to reach out to Chief Waters at (956) 433-6764 or via email at** [**fire@lvtexas.us**](mailto:fire@lvtexas.us)

**Together, we can keep Laguna Vista safe!**
